pullRequest.title: KOGITO-766: Kogito Keyboard Shortcuts API
pullRequest.bodyText:
On this PR:

Using the new Keyboard Shortcuts API to register existing keyboard shortcuts on Kogito environment. Syntax is very simple and keep in mind that "ctrl" gets replaced with "cmd" when running on macOS. Should we need a more flexible API in the future, we can change it.

VSIX for testing: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pKGSpn6xHm3sll8TH0XOc3fp6FMHjkN6/view?usp=sharing
Related PRs:
kiegroup/lienzo-core#102
kiegroup/lienzo-tests#84
kiegroup/appformer#922
#3221
kiegroup/kogito-tooling#86

nodes.bodyText: I don't think we should litter non kogito code with kogito terms.
I don't think we should litter non kogito code with kogito terms.
I don't think we should litter non kogito code with kogito terms.

I don't think we should litter non kogito modules with dependencies on kogito modules. BPMN and DMN have two clear codebases; Business Central and kogito. Only the existing 'kogitomodules should have additional dependencies onkogito` added.

commit.message: Improve API and add some other shortcuts
Fix arrow keys and general improvements
Fix lienzo zoom key on mac
Add JsInterop parameter to DMN kogito app as well
Removing Kogito hard dependency on non-Kogito modules

afterCommit.message: Removing Kogito hard dependency on non-Kogito modules

commit.message: Change key combinations to use KeyboardEvent.Key

nodes.bodyText: If this can be moved to -stunner-kogito-api I'd be happy.
If this can be moved to -stunner-kogito-client I'd be happy.
If this can be moved to -stunner-kogito-client I'd be happy.

Is this really an alternative or is it the default implementation?
I suspect annotating it @Alternative could give a runtime CDI/binding issue?
missing i18n
agree - on the core modules there should be no reference to kogito (eg: KogitoKeyPress)

nodes.bodyText: Could you please explain why this test needs to be removed and how the coverage is ensured?
We shouldn't register kogito specific shortcuts ( those with label & description) via non kogito codebase https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2271
Same here https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2271
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2271

I think mentioned also in kogito-tooling part. I see crucial to document somewhere the needed format of label , which is "Category of shortcut | Action description". Even more clear would be split label into two parameters.
